meta.content: Southern Schools - COVID-19 Pandemic update for Southern Public Schools March 23, 2020

After consultation with our Health Department and other State and Local officials, it has been determined that all schools in the ESU 5 Region will be closed through Friday, May 1 st , with the possibility of schools being closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This decision will be re-evaluated as circumstances change, and another announcement will be made on April 22 nd concerning the rest of the 2019-2020...

meta.title: Southern Schools - COVID-19 Pandemic update for Southern Public Schools March 23, 2020

div.em: Current conditions as of 22 Apr 08:35 am CDT

div.div: A slight chance of showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 1pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 73. South southeast wind 7 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

A 40 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly before 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 44. South wind 5 to 9 mph becoming north after midnight. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 77. North northwest wind 5 to 8 mph becoming calm in the afternoon.

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

div.h3: COVID-19 Pandemic update for Southern Public Schools March 23, 2020

blockquote.p: After consultation with our Health Department and other State and Local officials, it has been determined that all schools in the ESU 5 Region will be closed through Friday, May 1st, with the possibility of schools being closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This decision will be re-evaluated as circumstances change, and another announcement will be made on April 22nd concerning the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. This is a precautionary public health measure; local health and school officials are monitoring the COVID-19 situation in Southeast Nebraska closely. School Superintendents met with Public Health Solutions and determined that this action would help prevent exposure to our area to flatten the curve and decrease the spread of disease.
